description: Non Material Amendment to Planning Permission 20/01089/FUL (Demolition of existing single storey dwelling and garage and erection of a two storey dwelling with basement and garage; rooms in roofspace and basement linked to an enclosed single storey swimming pool and associated landscaping) to provide changes to window positions.
decision_conditions: The proposal, by reason of the extension to the lightwells at the front of the property, may have a material impact on the health and longevity of trees worthy of retention. Therefore, the Council considers the amendments to be material.

--- Officer Report ---IntroductionThis application is of a nature where the Council's Constitution delegates the authority to make the decision to Officers rather than it being decided by a Committee of Councillors.  Before preparing this summary report a Planning Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the relevant Development Plan policies and guidance, considered any relevant previous planning applications, and considered any comments made by those interested in the application such as consultees with specialist knowledge and nearby residents. By indicating that the development proposal complies with relevant Development Plan policies, the planning officer is taking into account the information submitted with the application, any previous relevant applications, any comments received in connection with the application and any other case specific considerations which are material to the decision.The Development Plan comprises:The London Plan 2021;RBK Core Strategy 2012;Kingston Town Centre Area Action Plan 2008; and,The South London Waste Plan 2022.This decision has been authorised by a Senior Officer (Authorising Officer) in the Development Management Service. Prior to endorsing the Planning Officer's recommendation, the Authorising Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the application documents, the relevant planning policies and guidance, any relevant history, and any representations received.Application SiteThe application site is located on the eastern side of Clarence Street and is a property currently in use as a nightclub, restaurant and cinema complex. The primary structure of the property on the right-hand side comprises a Grade II Listed Building (list entry no. 1358456) which was originally constructed in 1939 as the Granada Cinema, designed by George Coles with interior design by Komisarjevsky. A newer structure is attached to the original 1939 building on the left-hand side and therefore, attracts the same Listed Building status albeit a later addition with extensive remodelling. Public Consultation - No response received AssessmentThe application relates to the display of advertisements. The key considerations are AmenityPublic safetyAmenityClarence Street has contrasting styles of signage and methods of illumination. The applicant confirmed that the proposed signage letters will be metal which is considered acceptable. It is considered that the proposed illuminated signage and printed letters and logo would be of a sympathetic addition to and proportionate to the existing host property and would not detract from its character and appearance and the surrounding area. It is considered that the proposed signage would be subservient to the host property and that of the other signage on Clarence Street. The proposed illuminance levels of 197cd/sqm of the proposed signage is considered to be acceptable and would not result in any harmful light pollution.Given the modest scale, appropriate design and location, the proposed elements would not cause harm to the listed building as a designated heritage asset.Overall the proposal would not cause harm to the surrounding area and the statutorily listed building.Public safetyThe proposed signage would be static and would not obscure any highway signs or impede pedestrian movement. The proposed signage would not prejudice highway safety. ConclusionIn conclusion the proposed signage would accord with policies D3 of the London Plan 2021 and CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy.Details of the Application SubmissionIn accordance with the requirements of Local Government Act 1972 details of the application submission were available on the Council's website during the assessment of the application.https://www.kingston.gov.uk/info/200155/planning_applications_and_permissions/263/find_a_planning_application_or_appeal--- Informatives ---Positive and ProactiveIn dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

PLEASE READ CAREFULLY:On the 1st May 2024 the Council adopted a new Validation Local List. Please ensure that your application submission includes all the necessary documentation as required by the new local list. Then please complete and submit a Validation Checklist - Section 3. The new Validation Local List and checklists can be obtained via the council's website: https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applicationsThe LPA will not conduct any validation checks until the correct Checklist has been submitted. Upon receipt of a completed Checklist, the application will be assigned to a validation officer to review. Please do not simply state N/A in the checklist without a written justification.If you need to make any changes to your application please try to do this via the Planning Portal website where possible. If that is not possible please send amended documents via the email address quoted in this letter.
